Case Study: Single nucleus RNA-sequencing defines unexpected diversity of cholinergic neuron types in the adult mouse spinal cord

Kayla Interdonanto

Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center
Kayla.Morrell@RoswellPark.org

3 November 2022

Source: vignettes/hca-a7c66eb1-4a4e-4f6c-9e30-ad2a485f8301.Rmd
hca-a7c66eb1-4a4e-4f6c-9e30-ad2a485f8301.Rmd

Setup

Load useful packages

library(HCACaseStudies)
library(hca)
library(dplyr)

Project information

Set the project id

project_id <- "a7c66eb1-4a4e-4f6c-9e30-ad2a485f8301"

Display information about the project

project_information(project_id)
## Title
##   Single nucleus RNA-sequencing defines unexpected diversity of
##   cholinergic neuron types in the adult mouse spinal cord
## Contributors (unknown order; any role)
##   Sangeetha Hareendran, Claire,E,Le Pichon, Mor,R,Alkaslasi,
##   Timothy,J,Petros, Zoe,E,Piccus, Ami Day, Hanna Silberberg, Yajun
##   Zhang, Li Chen
## Description
##   In vertebrates, motor control relies on cholinergic neurons in the
##   spinal cord that have been extensively studied over the past hundred
##   years, yet the full heterogeneity of these neurons and their
##   different functional roles in the adult remain to be defined. Here,
##   we develop a targeted single nuclear RNA sequencing approach and use
##   it to identify an array of cholinergic interneurons, visceral and
##   skeletal motor neurons. Our data expose markers for distinguishing
##   these classes of cholinergic neurons and their rich diversity.
##   Specifically, visceral motor neurons, which provide autonomic
##   control, can be divided into more than a dozen transcriptomic classes
##   with anatomically restricted localization along the spinal cord. The
##   complexity of the skeletal motor neurons is also reflected in our
##   analysis with alpha, gamma, and a third subtype, possibly
##   corresponding to the elusive beta motor neurons, clearly
##   distinguished. In combination, our data provide a comprehensive
##   transcriptomic description of this important population of neurons
##   that control many aspects of physiology and movement and encompass
##   the cellular substrates for debilitating degenerative disorders.
## DOI
##   10.1038/s41467-021-22691-2
## URL
##   https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8087807/
## Project
##   https://data.humancellatlas.org/explore/projects/a7c66eb1-4a4e-4f6c-9e30-ad2a485f8301

Conventions

Statistics calculated locally use local.* for column names, e.g., local.cellCount.

Data processing

Project & samples

Create a filter to identify the project

project_filter <- filters(projectId = list(is = project_id))

Find the project

p <- projects(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")
p |> glimpse()

Samples associated with the project

s <- samples(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")

Columns are either variable and therefore describe sample-level information…

## informative 'specimen' or 'donorOrganisms' columns
s |>
    select(starts_with("specimens") | starts_with("donorOrganisms")) |>
    select(where(column_is_informative)) |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 36
## Columns: 4
## $ specimens.id                 <chr> "Thoracic_F4", "Lumbar_Sacral_M6", "Lumba…
## $ specimens.organPart          <list> "thoracic spinal cord", <"lumbar spinal …
## $ donorOrganisms.biologicalSex <chr> "female", "male", "male", "male", "female…
## $ donorOrganisms.id            <chr> "F4", "M6", "M3", "M3", "F6", "M2", "M1",…

    select(where(column_is_experimentwide)) |>
    distinct() |>

Data files

What types of files does the project have?

files1 <- files(project_filter)

files1 |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 64
## Columns: 8
## $ fileId       <chr> "dd14a889-14d7-4851-b0e8-ef793520648c", "055ede93-c6ec-4c…
## $ name         <chr> "Cervical_M_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz", "GSM5111195_Cervica…
## $ fileFormat   <chr> "fastq.gz", "tar.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz",…
## $ size         <dbl> 1839991510, 65759586, 1660748621, 1739763431, 3131442107,…
## $ version      <chr> "2022-08-11T13:58:14.426000Z", "2022-08-11T13:58:15.51000…
## $ projectTitle <chr> "Single nucleus RNA-sequencing defines unexpected diversi…

## $ url          <chr> "https://service.azul.data.humancellatlas.org/repository/…

files1 |>
    count(fileFormat)
## # A tibble: 5 × 2
##   fileFormat     n
##   <chr>      <int>
## 1 csv            1
## 2 csv.gz         1
## 3 fastq.gz      44
## 4 h5             9
## 5 tar.gz         9

## create `files2` with just the files needed for count-matrix
## analysis

files2 <- files1 |>
    filter(fileFormat == "csv.gz" | fileFormat == "csv")

Retrieve and cache locally all files needed to construct a gene x cell count matrix.

file_path <-
    files2 |>
    files_download() |>
    setNames(files2 |> pull(name))

## join file path to appropriate components of `f`
count_matrix_files1 <-
    files2 |>
    left_join(tibble(
        fileId = files2$fileId,
        local.filePath = unname(file_path)
    ), by = "fileId")

We can extract some data from the files, e.g., cell and gene counts

## 'files' is the final, locally modified, version of file data
count_matrix_files <-
    count_matrix_files1 |>
    filter(name == "GSE167597_allMN_countsmatrix.csv.gz") |>
    cell_count_csv() |>
    gene_count()

count_matrix_files |>
    select(name, local.geneCount, local.cellCount)
## # A tibble: 1 × 3
##   name                                local.geneCount local.cellCount
##   <chr>                                         <int>           <int>
## 1 GSE167597_allMN_countsmatrix.csv.gz           21457           16041

Count matrix

Create a dgCMatrix sparse matrix (defined in the Matrix package). Save it in the package cache for re-use across R sessions.

object_name <- "local.countMatrix"
if (!cache_exists(project_id, object_name)) {
    count_matrix_files |>
        count_matrix_csv() |>
        cache_add(project_id, object_name)
}
count_matrix <- cache_read(project_id, object_name)

class(count_matrix)[1] # sparse matrix
## [1] "dgCMatrix"
dim(count_matrix)      # genes x cells
## [1] 21457 16041
format(object.size(count_matrix), units = "auto")
## [1] "566.9 Mb"

Row, sample, and cell annotations

Row (gene) data

row_data <- tibble()

Column (sample & cell) data

sample_data <-
    ## from the hca sample annotation...
    s |>
    select(
        where(column_is_informative) & where(is.atomic)
    )
    ## ...and local computations, e.g.,gene and cell counts

sample_data

    pull(local.filePath) |>
    tail(1)

all_dat <- readr::read_csv(all_dat_filePath)

Experiment-wide metadata 

sample_metadata <-
    s |>
    select(where(column_is_experimentwide) & !any_of(names(p))) |>
    distinct()

metadata <- bind_cols(p, sample_metadata)

metadata |>
    glimpse()
